questions.question: It was careless …………………….. her to repeat that mistake.
questions.description: The adjective careless can be followed by ‘of + noun / pronoun + to-infinitive’.

questions.question: It is wicked of him ………………………. such things.
questions.description: The adjective wicked can be followed by ‘of + noun / pronoun + to-infinitive’.

questions.question: It is no use …………………… about it.
questions.description: The pattern is ‘it + be + no use / good etc. + -ing form’.

questions.question: It is strange …………………………
questions.description: The pattern is: it + be + adjective / noun + that clause.
answers: for him to behave like that
that he should have behaved like that

questions.question: It is a pity ……………………………..
questions.description: The pattern is: it + be + adjective / noun + that clause
answers: that you could not pass the test
for you not to pass the test
of you not to pass the test

questions.question: She was too arrogant …………………… to me.
She was stupid enough ………………… him.
questions.description: The pattern is: adjective / adverb + enough + to-infinitive

questions.question: I was so tired …………………………. any further.
questions.description: The pattern is: so + adjective / adverb + that – clause
answers: that I could not walk further

questions.question: What a charming girl ………………………..!
questions.description: The pattern is: what + adjective + noun + subject + verb

questions.question: …………………………….. tall you have grown!
questions.description: In exclamatory sentences we use ‘how’ before adjectives without nouns.

questions.question: If I find your watch, I …………………………… it to you.
questions.description: In first conditional sentences, we use a simple present tense in the if-clause and will + infinitive in the main clause.

questions.question: How …………………….. he plays!
questions.description: Well is an adverb. We need an adverb to modify a verb (play)
